page.title: 04FARMING IN WITHYHAM/ST.JOHN
page.content: On the outskirts of Crowborough there are quite a few{Farms.}Most of them have both{crops}and{livestock. The crops they mostly grow are Wheat and Barley but some vegetables are grown. Some of the farmers have cattle, sheep and horses some also have poultry. Farmers near the Ashdown Forest are allowed to let their sheep graze on it. This has been a right since the{Middle Ages. There has been a Farm on the exact sight of Friars Gate for 800 years. It was called Grubs Farm. An old lady who used to live there said it was a farm with all sorts of animals but now it is a riding school with a few sheep and pigs, also poultry. Gilridge Farm was a proper farm but now it has fruit which is a pick your own and it has a farm shop.X
